title: Foot Locker Stock Leaps on Report of Possible Takeover
snippets:
Foot Locker is flying.

Shares of the athletic footwear retailer were recently up more than 60% in late trading after The Wall Street Journal reported that Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS) was in talks to buy the company for about $2.3 billion.

The Journal said a deal could be completed by Thursday, and might value Foot Locker (FL) at $24 per share. That's an 86% premium to Wednesday's close of just under $13 and a price not seen since late last year. Foot Locker stock has lost some 40% of its value this year.

A deal at that per-share price would top Wall Street's average price target of below $19, according to Visible Alpha data, though a couple of the analysts tracked by the service have higher targets on the shares.

Dick's shares are down about 8% lower in 2025 as of Wednesday's close and were sliding in after-hours trading.

Foot Locker is scheduled to report quarterly financial results on May 29. Dick's results are set for a day earlier.
titles: Foot Locker Stock Leaps on Report of Possible Takeover
summary: Foot Locker's stock surged over 60% following a report by The Wall Street Journal that Dick's Sporting Goods is in discussions to acquire the company for approximately $2.3 billion. The potential deal, which could be finalized by Thursday, may value Foot Locker at $24 per share—an 86% increase from Wednesday's closing price. This valuation exceeds Wall Street's average target and comes after Foot Locker's shares dropped about 40% this year. Meanwhile, Dick's shares fell around 8% in 2025 and continued to decline in after-hours trading. Both companies are expected to announce their quarterly fi
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about a potential takeover deal, which can help readers make informed investment decisions. It also provides awareness about the current state of Foot Locker's stock and the potential impact of the deal. However, it doesn't report on any solutions, improvements, or innovations.

title: Watch These Palantir Price Levels as Stock Hits Another Record High
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Palantir shares closed at a record high Wednesday for the second consecutive day, as a cooling of global trade tensions has restored risk appetite and investor enthusiasm for AI stocks. 
  • The price consolidated within a pennant before breaking out above the pattern in Tuesday’s trading session, indicating a continuation of the stock’s longer-term uptrend.
  • Bars pattern analysis forecasts a potential upside target of around $210 in a move that could play out until early- to mid-June.
  • Investors should watch major support levels on Palantir's chart near $97 and $66.


Palantir Technologies (PLTR) shares hit another record high on Wednesday, as a cooling of global trade tensions has restored risk appetite and investor enthusiasm for AI stocks. 

The latest surge in the company's stock comes after the U.S. and China agreed Monday to slash their tariffs on one another for 90 days, with sentiment also receiving a boost earlier this week after Bank of America analysts called the AI analytics software provider a “market definer” for companies seeking to leverage artificial intelligence.

Palantir shares rose 1.6% on Wednesday to around $130, marking the second consecutive day that the AI favorite has hit all-time intraday and closing highs.

The stock had fallen 6% last week as the company’s higher-than-estimated earnings and outlook failed to meet investors’ lofty expectations. However, the stock has nearly doubled from last month’s low amid a rebound in the AI trade and expectations that the firm’s software could benefit from ongoing efforts to improve government efficiency.

Below, we break down the technicals on Palantir’s chart and identify major price levels that investors may be watching.

Pennant Pattern Breakout

After forming a piercing pattern early last month, Palantir shares have staged a sharp rally, climbing above the prominent February peak in the process. 

More recently, the price consolidated within a pennant before breaking out in Tuesday’s trading session, indicating a continuation of the stock’s longer-term uptrend.

Meanwhile, the relative strength index points to bullish momentum with a reading above the indicator’s neutral threshold, though it remains below overbought levels, providing ample room for further buying.

Let’s use technical analysis to forecast where the AI software provider’s stock may be headed next and also identify major support levels worth watching during potential retracements.

Bars Pattern Analysis

To forecast where the stock’s price may be headed next, investors can use bars pattern analysis, a technique that analyzes prior trends to predict future price movements.

When applying the analysis to Palantir’s chart, we extract the price bars comprising the stock’s trending move that immediately preceded the pennant and reposition them from the pattern’s breakout point. 

This projects an upside target of around $210 and indicates the move may play out until early to mid-June if the current trend higher replicates the prior trend analyzed.

Major Support Levels Worth Watching

During retracements, investors should pay close pay attention to the $97 level, currently situated just above the 50-day moving average (MA). The shares may encounter support in this area near the March peak, which closely aligns with brief period on consolidation that formed on the chart in mid-April.

Finally, selling below this major level could see Palantir shares test lower support around $66. Investors may seek entry points in this region near the close-by 200-day MA and a horizontal line that connects last month’s low with the notable January trough.

The comments, opinions, and analyses expressed on Investopedia are for informational purposes only. Read our warranty and liability disclaimer for more info.

As of the date this article was written, the author does not own any of the above securities.
titles: Watch These Palantir Price Levels as Stock Hits Another Record High
summary: Palantir Technologies shares reached another record high on Wednesday, continuing a surge fueled by reduced global trade tensions and growing investor interest in AI stocks. This marks the second consecutive day of record highs, with shares up 1.6% to around $130. The rise follows a U.S.-China agreement to cut tariffs and positive analysis from Bank of America. Technical analysis suggests a potential rise to $210 by mid-June, with major support levels at $97 and $66 to watch for during retracements.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides actionable insights for investors, including potential price levels to watch. It also provides awareness about the factors driving Palantir's stock price, including reduced global trade tensions and growing investor interest in AI stocks. However, it doesn't report on any solutions, improvements, or innovations at the company.

title: Men Are Dying More Than Women From These 3 Common Diseases
snippets: A global analysis reveals that there are sex-based health disparities in the prevalence and outcomes of hypertension, diabetes, and HIV/AIDS. In a groundbreaking global study, researchers have uncovered a troubling trend: men are more likely than women to suffer from, and die due to, three major health conditions, yet they’re also less likely to seek [...]
titles: Men Are Dying More Than Women From These 3 Common Diseases
summary: A global study has found that men are more likely to die from hypertension, diabetes, and HIV/AIDS compared to women. This research highlights significant sex-based health disparities in the prevalence and outcomes of these diseases. Additionally, it was noted that men are less likely to seek medical treatment for these conditions.
constructiveness_reason: The story provides useful insights into sex-based health disparities, increasing awareness about the prevalence and outcomes of certain diseases in men versus women. It also hints at a societal problem where men are less likely to seek medical treatment, which could stimulate further discussion or research.

title: Reversing Liver Disease? Scientists Discover New Health Benefit of Semaglutide
snippets: New research reveals that semaglutide significantly improves liver health in MASH patients. A new study published in the New England Journal of Medicine reveals that semaglutide significantly improves outcomes for patients with a serious form of liver disease, benefiting approximately two-thirds of those treated. The findings come from the ESSENCE phase 3 clinical trial, a [...]
titles: Reversing Liver Disease? Scientists Discover New Health Benefit of Semaglutide
summary: Researchers have found that semaglutide, a medication originally used for diabetes, significantly improves liver health in patients with a serious form of liver disease known as MASH. This conclusion comes from the ESSENCE phase 3 clinical trial results published in the New England Journal of Medicine. The study indicates that about two-thirds of the patients treated with semaglutide showed significant health benefits, marking a potential new treatment avenue for liver disease.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive as it reports on a potential new treatment for liver disease, highlighting innovation and progress in medical research. It provides empowering knowledge for patients and healthcare professionals, contributing to decision-making in health care.

title: $20 Pill vs $20,000 Surgery? Popular Diabetes Drug Metformin Found To Relieve Osteoarthritis Knee Pain
snippets: Metformin may reduce knee pain in overweight patients with osteoarthritis, offering a low-cost alternative to early knee replacement surgery, according to a Monash University trial. A widely used diabetes medication may help relieve knee osteoarthritis (OA) pain in people who are overweight or obese, potentially delaying the need for knee replacement surgery, according to new [...]
titles: $20 Pill vs $20,000 Surgery? Popular Diabetes Drug Metformin Found To Relieve Osteoarthritis Knee Pain
summary: A trial by Monash University has found that Metformin, a common diabetes drug, can reduce knee pain in overweight patients with osteoarthritis. This discovery presents a cost-effective alternative to knee replacement surgery, potentially delaying its need for individuals suffering from this condition.
constructiveness_reason: This story is very constructive as it reports on an innovative use of a common drug to potentially provide a cost-effective solution to a widespread health issue. It offers actionable insights for readers who may be suffering from osteoarthritis and increases awareness about an alternative treatment option.
